column5: It,s go time.  Now that the signs are up,lets hope it clicks in thier little brains,   that it means KEEP OUT.  After reading the replies from my first thread (Thanks Cram and Merc)Wouldnt want to kill someone.So I took the chain back and did this.Yes I know,I spelt it newfienezzzz.LOL They hit this,thier frigg,n blind.     Got the rest done all around the property. I made sure they were big enough so when asked,did you see the sign?        Now that signs were done and taken care of, it was time to clean up around the stands and get the feed out.  I picked up this blend from TSE.SMELT GOOD ENOUGH TO EAT.     Still pretty green and lots of leaves on the trees,but a good heavy rain and wind should knock them off.  Feeder filled    Stand one    Two    And three    Time came to set up the trail cam. New batteries,check,1GBchip,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,, DOH,left in on the pc table.Oh well.Still early yet.
NOW YOUR TALKIN BRIAN !!!! much more visible and less lethal.An if they dont get the picture, hide in the bushes in a grizly bear suit and scare the B-jeesus out of them !!!
Nice going B Hope that they get it now that the signs are up.... if not   I  When is bow hunt starting?  or as it already started Nice tree stands by the way J
How are you supposed to get deer if you keep telling them to KEEP OUT?
SILLY MAN....DEER CANT READ ENGLISH !!!! SHHEESH

Bow season started on the 1st J.  Work has been crazy Jac. This is my first time on the property since the spring turkey hunt(and that was only a one day out aswell).Oh I did see a big family of young turkeys.Hopefully I can fill both my fall deer and turkey tags this year.I make a bad track soup.  Thanks Merc.  Rodcaster,
That looks pretty sweet! Whats it run ya to buy land to hunt on? Prolly a couple grand and a few hundered bucks a year for property taxes?  Lucky you! Looks like you have a great season ahead of you!

I can fully understand your dilemma Brian, no fun at all but no worries.... I foresee 2 legged & 4 legged creatures walking along your stands this season Good luck shoot straight and be safe my friend!!! Jacques
Jacques,do you foresee me in the stands at the time of thier crossing? HAHAHAHAHAHA  TY my friend.  Always safety first.
Well.... let me see..... your going to have to choose one or flip a coin
HE SAID ON HIS ORIGINAL POST, HE ASKS THE LANDOWNERS PERMISSION TO HUNT ON HIS LAND. as i said in a previous post, you should read the WHOLE post and not just the words you can read.  peace  paul
Your set Brian, looks like a great area. I'm going to set my spots up on Monday.

Ok Jacques,so what yer saying is,good luck.LOL     TC1OZ  I dont own the land (wish I did) nor do I have to pay the taxes(thankfully,but would be willing to help if asked).I do though,share my havests with the land owner.My second year hunting on his property,I was lucky enough to shot a 7 pointer.He was given a quarter of the animal.Butchered and wrapped at my expense. The following spring,I was lucky to get two turkeys.First was mine,as it was my first,the second,was cleaned and wrapped and delivered by myself with a bottle of white wine.  Some have a hard time getting property due to problem tresspassers ignorant hunters.  If anyone is lucky enough to get such a piece of property,treat the owner like a best friend.
lol !!! he riled me up with his latest remark on your original post. go check it out.  breath in breath out.....
I think that second tree stand is too close to the ground.
Yeah that's pretty much it Brian LOL   and I hope you get to set your sights on a creature in the dead zone this season
